rules.natural: Provided that the stability test for productX passed, the batch of productX was accepted.
Under the condition that the potency of productX is within specification, the dissolution test for productX passed.
Either the potency of productX is within specification or the purity of productX is within specification.
If the purity of productX is within specification, then the stability test for productX passed.

An expedited review was conducted for productX or, if it is not the case that the potency of productX being within specification leads to productX being released, then a retest was ordered for productX.
Provided that documentation for productX is complete, the batch of productX was accepted.
Whenever regulatory approval for productX was obtained, then manufacturing of productX being complete implies that documentation for productX is complete.
Whenever management reviewed productX, the committee approved productX.
Either management reviewed productX or the automated system approved productX.
The quality check for productX passed or, if the batch of productX was not accepted, then the batch of productX is contaminated.
Under the condition that the automated system approved productX, then the QA audit passing for productX implies that regulatory approval for productX was obtained.
Provided that the committee approved productX, then the QA audit passing for productX leads to regulatory approval for productX being obtained.
If the cold chain for productX was maintained, then temperature logs for productX are complete.
Either the cold chain for productX was maintained or packaging integrity for productX was verified.
Provided that packaging integrity for productX was verified, then shipment of productX was not dispatched.
Whenever the carrier for productX is certified, shipment of productX was not dispatched.
Given that the logistics manager approved productX, then temperature logs being complete for productX implies that the carrier for productX is certified.
If equipment mixer3 malfunctioned, then the quality check for productX did not pass.
Either equipment mixer3 malfunctioned or raw material compoundB is defective.
Under the condition that corrective action for productX was implemented, a recall of productX was not initiated.
Whenever the dissolution test for productX passed, the bioavailability of productX is adequate.
If the bioavailability of productX is adequate, then productX was released.
Under the condition that raw material compoundB is defective, an impurity was detected in compoundB.

Provided that supervisor verified Jones, then either the sterilization protocol was followed or, if analyst Jones is trained, then an impurity being detected in compoundB leads to the quality check for productX not passing.
If productX was released, then the batch of productX was accepted.
Under the condition that it is not the case that the potency of productX being within specification implies productX being released, then a retest was not ordered for productX.
Provided that it is not the case that an investigation being opened into productX leads to a customer complaint about productX not being received, then a recall of productX was initiated.
If it is not the case that an investigation being opened into productX implies a customer complaint about productX not being received, then corrective action for productX was implemented.

Under the condition that it is not the case that it not being true that the potency of productX being within specification implies productX being released leads to a retest being ordered for productX, then a customer complaint about productX was received.

Provided that it is not the case that it not being true that the potency of productX being within specification leads to productX being released implies a retest was ordered for productX, then an investigation into productX was opened.
Provided that the batch of productX was not accepted, then shipment of productX was dispatched.
